page.title: 01The Bwlch-y-groes area.
page.content: We live in a rural area in North Pembrokeshire.It is a hilly region and there are coniferous and decidious trees on the slopes of the river valleys.Most of the people are concerned with agriculture and most of the farms are dairy farms.They sell milk,raise calves,grow barley and make silage.Most of the farms are small,usually under 100 acres.Most of the people speak Welsh but newcomers speak English.There are two public houses,the Fox and Hounds and the Falls Inn which also has rooms for guests.There are two Anglican churches and two Welsh chapels.In their spare time people attend the Women's Institute,Merched y Wawr and the local choir.There are two hamlets-Star and Llwyndrain.Some people travel out of the area to work.{
